silence: What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
river: What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
light: What can fill a room but takes up no space?
mirror: If you drop me, I’m sure to crack, but give me a smile and I’ll always smile back. What am I?
footsteps: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
key: I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
coffin: The person who makes it has no need for it; the person who buys it has no use for it. The person who uses it can neither see nor feel it. What is it?
stapler: With pointed fangs, I sit and wait; with piercing force, I crunch out fate; grabbing victims, proclaiming might; physically joining with a single bite. What am I?
map: I have lakes with no water, mountains with no stone, and cities with no buildings. What am I?
nothing: What does man love more than life, hate more than death or mortal strife; that which contented men desire; the poor have, the rich require; the miser spends, the spendthrift saves, and all men carry to their graves?
shadow:
Only one color, but not one size,
Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies.
Present in sun, but not in rain,
Doing no harm and feeling no pain.
What is it?
